citeinfo.origin: Fisheries and Oceans Canada - Ocean Science And Productivity, Pacific
citeinfo.title: Paleooceanography of Effingham Inlet, 1999

descript.abstract: NSERC-funded interdisciplinary study of ancient waters in Effingham Inlet.
descript.purpose: Paleooceanography of the ancient waters retained in Effingham inlet. Studying the history of pelagic fish since the last ice age.
descript.supplinf: Risk Justification: Data are in electronic format, well backed up and well documented. Risk of Loss: Low Impact Justification: Data of a particularly unique or valuable nature Impact of Loss: High Recommended Action: None

cntaddr.address: Institute of Ocean Sciences, P.O. Box 6000, 9860 West Saanich Road

dataqual.logic: CTD data processed using normal IOS processing procedures. Normal standardization of CTD instruments at IOS.
dataqual.complete: Dataset Complications: The accuracy of the CTD data may vary depending on the instruments used and whether collaborating data were collected for intercomparison purposes. Guildline CTDs are standardized at IOS; Sea-Bird CTD`s are calibrated at Sea-Bird Electronics in Bellevue, Washington.

procstep.procdesc: DFO, Carleton University, University of Victoria, University of British Columbia, NOAA, Pacific Geoscience Center (Nat. Resources)
